data.title: String length less than 10000 are still truncated
data.body: Tested #4952 - VSCode Version: 1.1.0-alpha e77003fd6ca90d944feb572b54fc1d122d91d704 - OS Version: MacOS Strings are still truncated. All relevant information about the string is given in the screenshot:

data.title: ESLint lightbulb not showing up in certain circumstances
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 10.12-alpha
- OS Version: Mac

Regarding test item #5654 
I'm not getting a lightbulb on one of my custom rules.

Also while this is less important, in my opinion it's not very intuitive for me to have to put my cursor at the beginning of an error.  Could you enable it whenever the cursor is over any part of an error (Maybe that's not possible)?

**Problems:**
## 1

With this setting,

```
"no-use-before-define": [
    "error"
]
```

I get an error, as expected, on trying to increment `brad` before I've defined it as a variable.  However, I get no lightbulb when the cursor is positioned at `brad` like I would get with some other error.

```
brad ++;
var brad = 1;
```
## 2

With no trailing commas rule, I also can't get a light bulb.

data.title: Debug: open debug console automatically if debugged process fails with error
data.body: While testing #4951: - VSCode Version: 1.1.0 alpha e77003fd6ca90d944feb572b54fc1d122d91d704 - OS Version: MacOS X Steps to Reproduce: 1. open vscode 2. create a file with the following content https://gist.github.com/kieferrm/6573389280bc8eb0ec72e0c1916706ba.js 3. use node version v4.4.3 4. within vscode debug the file (at this step the debug console is hidden) -> the execution fails and you see this. (No indication why it failed.) 1. Close the alert. -> The only indication that there is more information about the failure is the tiny red dot In situation like this the debug console should open automatically.

data.title: Can't install extensions on Ubuntu LTS 14.04
data.body:
- VSCode Version:1.0.0
- OS Version: Ubuntu 14.04 (via deb-package) on a virtualbox (via vagrant if that matters)

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open fresh installed VSCode within Ubuntu 14.04/virtualbox/vagrant
2. ext install tslint (or any other, as it doesn't matter)
3. Press the download button
4. Nothing happens (No popup, no install, no extension-dir in my home-folder, no errormessage)

No problem on the same setup with VSCode 0.10.xx (which was not really installed via deb, but only by extracted zip-File of VSCode, I think deb wasn't available at this time). Where may I take a look at, is there a log-File or something more verbose?

Thanks!

data.title: Git integration crashes once you upload a big file

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.0.0
- OS Version: 10.11.4

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Commit and push a big file like a psd (around 40 megabytes).
2. Git will push it but it will stay like constantly uploading the file when already has finished and will not refresh new changes to files to make others commits or push.
3. You will have to reset VSC in order to make the Git Integration works again.

data.title: Dependency Issue on Linux Install - Git
data.body:
Related to #5757 

While testing this I attempted to do a fresh install on Ubuntu through the package GUI.  I was using the .deb package from our home page on code.vs.com.

I got errors on getting several Git packages that blocked install.
- Failed to fetch http://security.ubuntu.com/ubuntu/pool/main/g/git/git-man_1.9.1-1ubuntu0.1_all.deb 404  Not Found [IP: 91.189.91.26 80]
- Failed to fetch http://security.ubuntu.com/ubuntu/pool/main/g/git/git_1.9.1-1ubuntu0.1_amd64.deb 404  Not Found [IP: 91.189.91.26 80]

Looking at the raw registry those files are indeed not there:
http://security.ubuntu.com/ubuntu/pool/main/g/git/

I assume they could have been updated?

I also did this via the console:
parallels@ubuntu:~/Downloads$ sudo dpkg -i vscode-amd64.deb 
[sudo] password for parallels: 
Selecting previously unselected package visual-studio-code.
(Reading database ... 196182 files and directories currently installed.)
Preparing to unpack vscode-amd64.deb ...
Unpacking visual-studio-code (1.0.0-1460557031) ...
dpkg: dependency problems prevent configuration of visual-studio-code:
 visual-studio-code depends on git; however:
  Package git is not installed.

dpkg: error processing package visual-studio-code (--install):
 dependency problems - leaving unconfigured
Processing triggers for gnome-menus (3.10.1-0ubuntu2) ...
Processing triggers for desktop-file-utils (0.22-1ubuntu1) ...
Processing triggers for bamfdaemon (0.5.1+14.04.20140409-0ubuntu1) ...
Rebuilding /usr/share/applications/bamf-2.index...
Processing triggers for mime-support (3.54ubuntu1) ...
Errors were encountered while processing:
 visual-studio-code
parallels@ubuntu:~/Downloads$

Actual: Navigating to license page but there are no contents.
https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items/austin.code-gnu-global/license

data.title: Looping JS grammar
data.body: Tracking issue for Microsoft/vscode-textmate#9

data.title: Clicking a moved file's git entry attempted to load the file - from its old location
data.body:
I moved a file from one folder to another (by dragging it in the explorer tree), and then also renamed it. Clicking the git entry for the "deleted" file path apparently attempted to open the file at its old location, causing an error. This seems wrong - the application should've known that the file isn't there.

However, I wasn't actually able to reproduce it - doing the move/rename again and clicking the equivalent git entry didn't try to open it. Restarting VS Code, I can now click the git entry again (for "internal_user_nav.html") and it displays the contents of the file (at the time of the move).

This is minor, of course, but reporting it anyway since something clearly wasn't completely correct, even if it was transient.
- VSCode Version: 1.0.0 (Commit fa6d0f03813dfb9df4589c30121e9fcffa8a8ec8)
- OS Version: Debian stretch

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Unknown.

![screenshot](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/995315/14825709/dca010fc-0bd2-11e6-8117-c6a56cf3d107.png)

data.title: Multiple Code.exe processes running in Windows Task Manager

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.00 (Stable)
- OS Version: Mac OSX Yosmite 10.10.4 - running VmWare Fusion 7.12 with guest OS: Windows 7 64-Bit

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Install VS Code 1.00 (stable)
2. Open VS Code

VS Code takes an extremely long time to open (30 seconds to over a minute). CPU performance spikes to 100%.  I see 2 Code.exe processes running in Windows Task Manager before it opens.  But once it opens, I see MANY instances of Code.exe running.

![vscodeprocessors](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6518508/14825660/c5ef2534-0ba8-11e6-96a9-85d91bd21d75.jpg)

data.title: Reopen closed files should also reopen closed editors
data.body:
while testing #5586
- VSCode Version: alpha
- OS Version: linux

Steps to Reproduce:
1. open a file in an editor, close it by closing the editor (cltr + w)
2. ctrl + shift + t, the file is not reopened

I understand that the file is still in the working files and that the action might not be designed to do this. But IMHO this is very confusing for the user, most of our users have no clue what is a difference between closing an editor and closing a file and this action would just confuse them.

Setting to april for discussion
FYI @bpasero

data.title: Highlight changed stack frames

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
When hitting various breakpoints in a complicated program, it might be helpful for the stack frame area of the debug viewlet to highlight / animate in a tasteful fashion the stack frame delta.

e.g. 

Before stack
fileA:35
fileB:40
fileC:50

-> steps into or continues

After stack
fileA:29
fileA:35
fileB:40
fileC:50

Would be nice if fileA:29 would be briefly and tastefully highlighted.

data.title: File exclusion and inclusion are behaving differently in search with same regex.
data.body:
- VSCode Version:1.1.0-alpha
- OS Version: Windows10

Setup:
My Directory structure for CSS file.
{$workspaceRoot}\timer-styles1.css
{$workspaceRoot}\Scripts\timer-styles3.css
{$workspaceRoot}\Contents\app.css

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Launch app and open any folder which contains .CSS and .ts file with keyword "width".
2. Perform search for keyword: width. 
- Include .css file with regex: *.css
  -Exclude .css file with regex: *.css
1. Verify search result in both the conditions.

Actual: File exclusion is only excluding .css file which is located at the root dir (in my case {$workspaceRoot}\timer-styles1.css)  whereas file inclusion is displaying result for all the available css file (root dir as well as sub directories)
Expected: File include and exclude filter should work uniformly for same regex.
![searchregexissueforexcludefile1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17735796/14824298/5698f124-0b8a-11e6-891d-9ec54e467b78.gif)

data.title: Launch extension in empty folder if target folder already opened in window
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Alpha
- OS Version: OS X

Steps to Reproduce:
1. open any folder in vscode
2. open a new window in vscode and open your extension
3. launch your extension -> notice that the first vscode window is focused, and a new third window is not opened

Works in stable -> important

data.title: Reopen Closed File: Skip files that recently closed files that are currently open
data.body:
Refs: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/5586
- have files 1, 2, 3, 4
- all in working files
- have 4 open
- click on the close button of 3 in working files
- open 3 again and make it a working file
- Ctrl+Shift+T should be a no-op now because no working file was closed

=> still it ends up opening 3 and then 4

data.title: Debug: Node program never stops debugging
data.body:
Testing #4954
- Create an empty `.js` file.
- Configure Code to debug it.
- Launch debugging.

Debugging should stop immediately since the file doesn't do anything. It never does! 👎

data.title: Clicking on image links either does not open or opens within
data.body:
Refs: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/5747

Repo: https://github.com/bpasero/vscode-markdown.git

Open a markdown preview (F1 > Open Markdown Preview) with badges from a readme.md (e.g. the express module) and click on a badge. On Linux nothing happens for me, on Mac I am able to open the link within the preview:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/900690/14820804/73bda63a-0bc8-11e6-9ebc-e48735f0334e.png)
